source_sentence: ◎佛說九色鹿經一卷
translation: Śṛgālavādasūtra (Sutra on the Nine Colored Deer), one volume

source_sentence: 吳月氏優婆塞支謙譯
translation: Wu Yuezhi Upāsaka Zhiqian Translation

source_sentence: 昔者，菩薩身為九色鹿；其毛九種色，其角白如雪，常在恒水邊飲食水草，常與一烏為知識。
translation: Once upon a time, the bodhisattva was a nine-colored deer with fur of nine colors and horns as white as snow that used to eat water and grass at the edge of constant water and was always in the company of a crow.

source_sentence: 時，水中有一溺人隨流來下，或出或沒，得著樹木，仰頭呼天：「山神、樹神、諸天龍神，何不愍傷於我？」
translation: When a submerged man in the water came down with the current, sometimes emerging or submerging, he got caught in a tree and looked up and called to the gods, "Why don't you pity me, mountain gods, tree gods, and gods of gods and dragons?"

source_sentence: 鹿聞人聲，走到水中，語溺人言：「汝莫恐怖！
translation: When the deer heard the sound of the man, it went into the water and said to the submerged man, "Don't be afraid!

source_sentence: 汝可騎我背上，捉我兩角，我當相負出水。」
translation: You may ride on my back and grab my two horns, and I'll carry you out of the water."

source_sentence: 既得着岸，鹿大疲極，溺人下地，遶鹿三匝，向鹿叩頭：「乞與大家作奴供給，使令採取水草。」
translation: Having reached the shore, the deer was so exhausted that the drowned man went down to the ground, circled the deer three times, and bowed his head to it, "Please give us all slaves to serve you, so that you may take the water and grass."

source_sentence: 鹿言：「不用汝也，且各自去，欲報恩者，莫道我在此，人貪我皮角，必來殺我。」
translation: The deer said, "I don't need you, so go your separate ways. Those who want to repay me for my kindness shouldn't tell me I'm here; people who crave my skin and horns will surely come and kill me."

source_sentence: 於是，溺人受教而去。
translation: The drowning man then accepted the teaching and departed.

source_sentence: 是時，國王夫人夜於臥中夢見九色鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪，即託病不起。
translation: At the time, the king's wife was lying in bed at night and dreamt that she saw a nine-colored deer with fur of nine different colors and horns as white as snow.

source_sentence: 王問夫人：「何故不起？」
translation: The king asked the lady, "Why isn't it awake?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我昨夜夢見非常之鹿，其毛九種色，其角白如雪。
translation: He answered, "Last night, I dreamt that I saw an extraordinary deer whose hair was nine different colors and whose horns were as white as snow.

source_sentence: 我思得其皮作坐褥，欲得其角作拂柄，王當為我覔之？
translation: I was thinking about getting its hide to make a seat and its horns to make a handle for my hair.

source_sentence: 王若不得者，我便死矣。」
translation: If the king doesn't get it, I'll die."

source_sentence: 王告夫人：「汝可且起，我為一國之主，何所不得？」
translation: The king told the lady, "You may rise, for I am the lord of a kingdom; why wouldn't I get it?"

source_sentence: 王即募於國中：「若有能得九色鹿者，吾當與其分國而治，即賜金鉢盛滿銀粟，又賜銀鉢盛滿金粟。」
translation: The king then summoned the kingdom, "If someone can get the nine-colored deer, I will divide the country and rule it with them, giving them a gold bowl full of silver and a silver bowl full of gold."

source_sentence: 於是，溺人聞王募重，心生惡念：「我說此鹿可得富貴，鹿是畜生，死活何在？」
translation: Then, when the drowning man heard that the king was asking for more, he had a bad thought, "I told you that this deer would bring wealth and prosperity; it's an animal, so why should it live or die?"

source_sentence: 於是，溺人即便語募人言：「我知九色鹿處。」
translation: Even then, the drowning man said to the recruiter, "I know the place of the nine colored deer."

source_sentence: 募人即將溺人至大王所，而白王言：「此人知九色鹿處。」
translation: The recruiter then led the drowning man to the king and told him, "This man knows the place of the nine colored deer."

source_sentence: 王聞此言，即大歡喜，便語溺人：「汝若能得九色鹿者，我當與汝半國，此言不虛。」
translation: When the king heard this, he was overjoyed and said to the drowning man, "If you can get the nine colored deer, I will give you half of my country; that's true."

source_sentence: 溺人答王：「我能得之。」
translation: The drowning man answered the king, "I can get it."

source_sentence: 於是，溺人面上即生癩瘡。
translation: Thereupon, the drowning man's face became covered with scabies.

source_sentence: 溺人白王：「此鹿雖是畜生，大有威神，王宜多出人眾，乃可得耳。」
translation: The drowning man said to the king, "Although this deer is an animal, it's quite powerful; it would be better for the king to send out a large army of people to get it."

source_sentence: 王即大出軍眾，往至恒水邊。
translation: The king then sent out a large army and went to the edge of the Gaṅgā River.

source_sentence: 時，烏在樹頭見王軍來，疑當殺鹿，即呼鹿曰：「知識且起！
translation: When a crow in a tree saw the king's army coming, he suspected that he would kill the deer and called to the deer, "Get up, you!

source_sentence: 王來取汝。」
translation: The king has come to get you."

source_sentence: 鹿故不覺，烏便下樹，踞其頭上，啄其耳言：「知識且起！
translation: The deer therefore didn't realize it, so the crow descended from the tree, sat on its head, and pecked its ear, saying, "Get up, you fool!

source_sentence: 王軍至矣。」
translation: The king's army has arrived."

source_sentence: 鹿方驚起，便四向顧視，見王軍眾，已遶百匝無復走地，即趣王車前。
translation: When the deer startled, it looked around and saw the king's army, which had circled around a hundred times and hadn't gone off the ground again, and went to the king's chariot.

source_sentence: 時，王軍人即便挽弓欲射，鹿語王人：「且莫射我，自至王所，欲有所說。」
translation: Even as the king's army was about to shoot it, the deer said to the king's men, "Don't shoot me; I've come to the king because I want to tell him something."

source_sentence: 王便勅諸臣：「莫射此鹿，此是非常之鹿，或是天神。」
translation: The king then commanded his ministers, "Don't shoot this deer; it's an extraordinary deer or a god."

source_sentence: 鹿重語大王言：「且莫殺我！
translation: The deer again said to the king, "Don't kill me!

source_sentence: 我有大恩在於王國。」
translation: I have a great favor to do in the kingdom."

source_sentence: 王語鹿言：「汝有何恩？」
translation: The king said to the deer, "What kindness do you have?"

source_sentence: 鹿言：「我前活王國中一人。」
translation: The deer said, "I was once alone in a living kingdom."

source_sentence: 鹿即長跪，重問王言：「誰道我在此耶？」
translation: The deer then knelt down long and repeatedly asked the king, "Who told you that I was here?"

source_sentence: 王便指示車邊癩面人是。
translation: The king then instructed the bald-faced man at the edge of the chariot.

source_sentence: 鹿聞王言，眼中淚出，不能自止，鹿言：「大王！
translation: When the deer heard the king's words, tears welled up in its eyes, and it couldn't stop itself.

source_sentence: 此人前日溺深水中，隨流來下，或出或沒，得着樹木，仰頭呼天：『山神、樹神、諸天龍神，何不愍傷於我？』
translation: That man, who had been submerged in deep water the day before and had come down with the current, sometimes emerging or submerging, caught hold of a tree and looked up and called to the gods, 'Why don't you pity me, mountain gods, tree gods, and the gods of the gods and dragons?'

source_sentence: 我於爾時不惜身命，自投水中負此人出，本要不相道，人無反復，不如負水中浮木。」
translation: At the time, I didn't spare my own life and threw myself into the water to carry this man out, for it would have been better not to share the road with him and for him not to retaliate than to carry a floating log in the water."

source_sentence: 王聞鹿言，甚大慙愧，責數其民語言：「汝受人重恩，云何反欲殺之？」
translation: When the king heard what the deer said, he was deeply embarrassed and rebuked his people, saying, "You've received a great favor from a man, why would you want to kill him?"

source_sentence: 於是，大王即下令於國中：「自今已往，若駈逐此鹿者，吾當誅其五族。」
translation: Thereupon, the king ordered the kingdom, "From now on, if someone hastens to chase this deer, I will kill five of their clans."

source_sentence: 於是，眾鹿數千為群，皆來依附，飲食水草不侵禾稼，風雨時節五穀豐熟，人無疾病災害不生，其世太平運命化去。
translation: Thereupon, the deer, numbering in the thousands, all came to depend on them, ate and watered grass that didn't attack the crops, the rains and winds produced abundant harvests, no illness or calamity arose among the people, and the peace of the world was transformed away.

source_sentence: 佛言：「爾時九色鹿者，我身是也；爾時烏者，今阿難是；時國王者，今悅頭檀是；時王夫人者，今先陀利是；時溺人者，今調達是。
translation: The Buddha said, "At the time, the nine-colored deer was me; at the time, the crow was presently Ānanda; at the time, the king was presently Yuletus; at the time, the king's wife was presently Sindhārī; and at the time, the drowned man was presently Tadra.

source_sentence: 調達與我世世有怨，我雖有善意向之，而故欲害我；阿難有至意，得成無上道。」
translation: Tathāgata and I have had enemies from generation to generation, and although I had good intentions toward him, he wanted to harm me; Ānanda had the best intentions, and he was able to achieve the unsurpassed path."

source_sentence: 菩薩行羼提波羅蜜，忍辱如是。
translation: This is how a bodhisattva practices the perfection of forbearance.

source_sentence: 佛說九色鹿經一卷
translation: Sutra of the Nine-Colored Deer, One Volume
